body:
@magallardo  I assume the logs are truncated because they should also include a note, that the gRPC and REST servers are started in OVMS container.
It is likely that the problem is caused the the proxy settings. By default, the clients are connecting to `localhost` address so make sure it is added to `no_proxy` variable or http_proxy is unset. You could just test it with `curl` command to confirm connectivity with the docker container endpoint.

@dtrawins The logs are not truncated.  That is all the is displayed in the console.  I have also tried calling the service from postman and curl and got a "Could get response" error.
I will investigate using the proxy settings but for any other containers with REST endpoints on this machine I have not had to set anything.

If the logs are not complete, does it mean the REST and gRPC components are not starting?

Thanks,
Marcelo

@magallardo In the logs there should be info about started grpc and rest servers. It looks like they were not. It might be the best to check the docker container status with `docker inspect <container_name>`. Maybe your computer is running out of memory so docker engine terminated the container prematurely? Do you have some RAM restrictions for docker on the MAC?

@dtrawins This machine has plenty of resources and I have been running other containers without any issue.  I have also run the Openvino Workbench container without a problem.  I also just rebooted the machine to make sure nothing else is running while I try to run the model server and the logs still don't show any note regarding REST and gRPC starting.
I also tried docker inspect and everything seems ok.  I am attaching the output from docker inspect and maybe you can help me see if something is wrong.

Is any other way to verify all required components are running?

Thanks for all your help.

Marcelo

@magallardo That is very weird. What is the CPU platform and your MAC model? Are you getting the same symptoms on other machines?
We documented how to debug OVMS code in the [developer guide](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/model_server/blob/main/docs/developer_guide.md#debugging-) I'm not able to reproduce such behaviour on my Macbook Pro. Perhaps this debug procedure could reveal the root cause.

@dtrawins Just to give you some more information, I am running the Openvino Model Server on a MacBook Pro with 2.6 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7.  The OS is MacOS Catalina 10.15.6.

Also, I have installed Openvino framework and all the samples including the Json samples work ok.  I am only having issues running the docker container for Openvino Model Server.

Thanks,
Marcelo

@magallardo Do you observe the same symptoms with the latest docker image `openvino/model_server:2021.2`. 
I was not able to reproduce those symptoms on MAC hosts. A possible troubleshooting could be via starting ovms with [strace](https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man1/strace.1.html) or running the ovms via [gdb](docs/developer_guide.md#debug). To test it with strace, you would need to start the docker container with updated entrypoint `--entrypoint bash` and `--user root`, installed strace with`yum install strace` and starting ovms like `strace /ovms/bin/ovms --model_name ...`
@magallardo I assume the issue is resolved with the latest 2021.2  ovms image ? Will close the bug if no reply in 2 weeks.
